What's New in Beast 2013.2.x
Beast 2013.2.x
Beast 2013.1.x
 
Migration Guide > Previous Releases > Beast 2013.2.x > 

Upgrade Requirements for Beast 2013.2.x

 
 
 

There are no code changes needed to compile with this release.

However, the following items have changed:

  • The Monte Carlo integrator has been removed, as it has been superseded by the new physical rendering system.
  • Sky lights now use explicit sampling even for solid colors, for consistent behavior between textured and solid color skylights.

  • The TGA reader no longer interprets the alpha value 0xFF in all pixels as indicating no alpha channel.

    The ILBExecuteBeast(), ILBSetSkyLightVolumeType() and ILBGetSkyLightVolumeType() functions have been deprecated, and will be removed in an upcoming release.

Please send us your comment about this page
